meanings.definition: To take a radiograph of (a part of the body)
meanings.sent1: The dentist was radiographing my teeth to check for cavities.
meanings.sent2: The technician is radiographing the patient's broken arm to assess the damage.
meanings.sent3: The doctor joked that he was radiographing so much that he was starting to glow.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she was radiographing her own soul when she analyzed the X-ray images.
meanings.sent5: Radiographing the spine is like capturing a hidden puzzle of bones and tissues.

meanings.definition: The process of creating an image using X-rays
meanings.sent1: Radiographing is essential in diagnosing bone fractures.
meanings.sent2: The radiographing of the chest revealed a shadow that needed further investigation.
meanings.sent3: The art exhibit showcased the beauty of radiographing in a unique way.
meanings.sent4: Her mind worked like a radiographing machine, capturing details others might miss.
meanings.sent5: The museum displayed ancient artifacts alongside modern radiographing equipment.
